summary: Review and optimize workflow activation logic in the TypeScript SDK, including handling of signals execution order, activation errors, and microtask synchronization requirements.
userImpact: Users need clarity on how signals are processed in workflows and whether sequential delivery should be supported as an option.
proposedFix: Maintain concurrent signal delivery (current behavior) and provide channel-based syntactic sugar for users who need sequential signal processing, rather than implementing framework-level sequential delivery options.
workaround: Users can implement sequential signal processing using UnboundedChannel to buffer signals from signal handlers.
resolutionDetails: Decision made to keep concurrent signal delivery model and document channel-based alternatives for sequential processing rather than add API complexity.
keyQuote: As a Node dev, I'm used to the thought that my current function is going to be called non-sequentially, and program accordingly.
